unnormalised: Gurgaon's Cyber Hub faces significant disruptions due to infrastructural issues, particularly concerning access roads and parking facilities. A recent report highlighted that approximately 75% of employees experience delays reaching their offices located at DLF Cyber City, Phase 2, Gurgaon, 122002, during peak hours. This is primarily attributed to the limited capacity of the approach roads connecting NH-48 to the business district.
normalised: Gurgaon's Cyber Hub faces significant disruptions due to infrastructural issues, particularly concerning access roads and parking facilities. A recent report highlighted that approximately seventy five percent of employees experience delays reaching their offices located at D-L-F Cyber City, Phase two, Gurgaon, one two two zero zero two, during peak hours. This is primarily attributed to the limited capacity of the approach roads connecting N-H-forty eight to the business district.

unnormalised: Several multinational corporations, including Google India Pvt Ltd, Building No. 10, DLF Cyber City, and Tata Consultancy Services, DLF Phase-II, Gurgaon, 122002, have voiced concerns regarding the impact on employee productivity and operational efficiency. The lack of adequate parking space further exacerbates the problem, leading to traffic congestion and delays. The local authorities are urged to expedite ongoing infrastructure projects to address these critical issues.
normalised: Several multinational corporations, including Google India Private Limited, Building Number ten, D-L-F Cyber City, and Tata Consultancy Services, D-L-F Phase-two, Gurgaon, one two two zero zero two, have voiced concerns regarding the impact on employee productivity and operational efficiency. The lack of adequate parking space further exacerbates the problem, leading to traffic congestion and delays. The local authorities are urged to expedite ongoing infrastructure projects to address these critical issues.

unnormalised: Furthermore, the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII) has proposed a multi-stakeholder dialogue to formulate comprehensive solutions, encompassing improved public transportation, enhanced road networks, and dedicated parking zones. CII Headquarters is at 23, Institutional Area, Lodi Road, New Delhi, 110003. The Haryana government has assured prompt action.
normalised: Furthermore, the Confederation of Indian Industry (C-I-I) has proposed a multi-stakeholder dialogue to formulate comprehensive solutions, encompassing improved public transportation, enhanced road networks, and dedicated parking zones. C-I-I Headquarters is at twenty three, Institutional Area, Lodi Road, New Delhi, one one zero zero zero three. The Haryana government has assured prompt action.

unnormalised: The state government plans to allocate â‚¹500 crore to revamp the infrastructure around Cyber Hub. This includes widening the existing roads, constructing new flyovers, and creating multi-level parking facilities. The project is expected to commence by Q3 2024 and be completed within 18 months, aiming to resolve the persisting connectivity challenges impacting businesses in Gurgaon.
normalised: The state government plans to allocate rupee five hundred crore to revamp the infrastructure around Cyber Hub. This includes widening the existing roads, constructing new flyovers, and creating multi-level parking facilities. The project is expected to commence by Q-three two thousand and twenty four and be completed within eighteen months, aiming to resolve the persisting connectivity challenges impacting businesses in Gurgaon.
